snippet: UEFA hinted that the appearance of a flare among Russian fans, banned by its rules, would not lead to Russia’s expulsion from Euro 2016. Its play in a 2-1 loss to Slovakia might, however.
abstract: UEFA is unlikely to expel Russia from European Championship over flare set off in stadium by fan during match against Slovakia, as rules do not specify flares as crowd disturbance'; team was given suspended disqualification after its fans were charged with inciting violence at earlier match and another such violation would result in ejection from tournament.

byline.contributor: Benoît Morenne contributed reporting from Lille, France.

lead_paragraph: UEFA hinted that the appearance of a flare among Russian fans, banned by its rules, would not lead to Russia’s expulsion from Euro 2016. Its play in a 2-1 loss to Slovakia might, however.

headline.main: A Flare in the Stands Signals Trouble for Russia
headline.print_headline: A Flare in the Stands Could Signal Russia’s Exit
